pnTable.name: Master Shape of the Earth Table

reference.title: Product Name Standard Document
reference.organization: Fleet Numerical Meteorology and Oceanography Center

reference.title: GRIB 2
reference.infoUsed: GRIB2 Shape of the Earth, table 3.2

entry.name: sphere_rad1
entry.description: Earth assumed spherical with radius = 6,367,470.0 meters.

entry.name: sphere_rad_specfd_m
entry.description: Earth assumed spherical with radius specified (in m) by data producer.

entry.name: obl_sphrd_iau1965
entry.description: Earth assumed oblate spheriod with size as determined by IAU in 1965 (major axis = 6,378,160.0 meters, minor axis = 6,356,775.0 meters, f = 1/297.0).

entry.name: obl_sphrd_axis_specfd_km
entry.description: Earth assumed oblate spheriod with major and minor axes specified (in kilometers) by data producer.

entry.name: obl_sphrd_iag-grs80
entry.description: Earth assumed oblate spheriod with size as determined by IAG-GRS80 model (major axis = 6,378,137.0 meters, minor axis = 6,356,752.314 meters, f = 1/298.257222101).

entry.name: wgs84
entry.description: Earth assumed represented by WGS84 (as used by ICAO since 1998).

entry.name: sphere_rad2
entry.description: Earth assumed spherical with radius = 6,371,229.0 meters.

entry.name: obl_sphrd_axis_spec_m
entry.description: Earth assumed oblate spheroid with major and minor axes specified (in meters) by data producer.

entry.name: sphere_rad3_wgs84
entry.description: Earth model assumed spherical with radius 6,371,200 meters but the horizontal datum of the resulting Latitude/Longitude field is WGS84 reference frame.

entry.name: osgb1936_airy1830sphrd_greenwich_newlyn_0
entry.description: Earth represented by the Ordnance Survey Great Britain 1936 Datum, using the Airy 1830 Spheroid, the Greenwich meridian as 0 longitude, and the Newlyn data as mean sea level, 0 height.

entry.name: wgs84_corr_Gustafsson1992
entry.description: Earth model assumed WGS84 with corrected geomagnetic coordinates *latitude and longitude) defined by Gusrafsson et al., 1992
Reserved.

entry.name: sphere_sun_stonyhurst
entry.description: Sun assumed spherical with radius = 695,990,000 m (Allen, C.W. 1976 Astrophysical Quantities (3rd Ed.; London: Athlone)) and Stonyhurst latitude and longitude system with origin at the intersection of the solar central meridian (as seen from Earth) and the solar equator (Thompson, W, Coordinates systems for solar image data, A&A 449, 791-803 (2006)).
Reserved.

entry.name: sphere_sun_carrington
entry.description: Sun assumed spherical with radius = 695,990,000 m (Allen, C.W. 1976 Astrophysical Quantities (3rd Ed.; London: Athlone)) and Carrington latitude and longitude system that rotates with a sidereal period of 25.38 days (Thompson, W, Coordinates systems for solar image data, A&A 449, 791-803 (2006)).
Reserved.

entry.name: reserved
entry.description: Reserved for use by WMO.
Reserved.

entry.name: reserved local
entry.description: Reserved for local use.

entry.name: missing
entry.description: Missing
